intro: Ruellia jacquemontiana, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ruellia jacquemontiana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
